prompt: <description>**Part 1** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation or translation. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Draw the following lines on the sketch to form the first face: - Line 1: Starting point at (0, 0), ending point at (0.75, 0) - Line 2: Starting point at (0.75, 0), ending point at (0.75, 0.5473) - Line 3: Starting point at (0.75, 0.5473), ending point at (0, 0.5473) - Line 4: Starting point at (0, 0.5473), ending point at (0, 0) Create a second loop on the same face by drawing: - Line 1: Starting point at (0.0507, 0.0507), ending point at (0.6993, 0.0507) - Line 2: Starting point at (0.6993, 0.0507), ending point at (0.6993, 0.4966) - Line 3: Starting point at (0.6993, 0.4966), ending point at (0.0507, 0.4966) - Line 4: Starting point at (0.0507, 0.4966), ending point at (0.0507, 0.0507) Close all loops. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.3547 units. **Part 2** Construct another three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Create a new coordinate system at (0.0507, 0.0507, 0) with no rotation. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. Draw the following lines on the sketch to form the face: - Line 1: Starting point at (0, 0), ending point at (0.6486, 0) - Line 2: Starting point at (0.6486, 0), ending point at (0.6486, 0.4459) - Line 3: Starting point at (0.6486, 0.4459), ending point at (0, 0.4459) - Line 4: Starting point at (0, 0.4459), ending point at (0, 0) Close all loops. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.0253 units. Join the new part with the previous part. The resulting shape should be a rectangular prism with curved sides along the Y-axis. The height, width, and length of each intermediate part, as well as the final shape, are as follows: - Part 1 height: 0.3547, width: 0.75, length: 0.75 - Part 2 height: 0.0253, width: 0.6486, length: 0.6486 - Final shape height: 0.3801, width: 0.75, length: 0.75</description>
